title: Sorgenfrey plane
summary: In topology, the Sorgenfrey plane is a frequently-cited counterexample to many otherwise plausible-sounding conjectures.  It consists of the product of two copies of the Sorgenfrey line, which is the real line R {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} } under the half-open interval topology. The Sorgenfrey line and plane are named for the American mathematician Robert Sorgenfrey.
